content.webTitle: Arsenal v Aston Villa: match preview

fields.headline: Arsenal v Aston Villa: match preview
fields.bodyText: Aston Villa’s defence has regressed to the levels that almost resulted in relegation last season but Emiliano Martínez may hold the key to renewed fortification. The former Arsenal keeper has the inside track on Mikel Arteta and will be licking his lips at the chance to show the club they made a mistake in cashing in. Motivation may be totally irrelevant, though, as Arsenal seem to have skewed too heavily toward preventing goals. Yes, conceding two against Manchester City, Leicester and Manchester United is an amazing upgrade but scoring one in that period feels far too meagre for long-term success. Spain’s own George Graham will be unconcerned with stats, though, and focused on driving his side to feed off the victory at Old Trafford. Graham Searles Sunday 7.15pm Sky Sports Box Office Venue Emirates Stadium Last season Arsenal 3 Aston Villa 2 Odds H 8-11 A 4-1 D 3-1 Referee Martin Atkinson This season G6 Y14 R1 2.5 cards/game ARSENAL Subs from Rúnarsson, Macey, Saliba, Soares, Kolasinac, Maitland-Niles, Willock, Smith Rowe, Pépé, Nketiah, Xhaka, Ceballos, Mustafi Doubtful None Injured Nelson (knee, 21 Nov), Marí (ankle, 21 Nov), Chambers (knee, Dec), Martinelli (knee, unknown) Suspended None Discipline Y11 R0 Form WLWLLW Leading scorer Lacazette 3 ASTON VILLA Subs from Kalinic, Steer, Taylor, Nakamba, El Ghazi, Jota, Guilbert, Elmohamady, Davis, Ramsey, Chrisene, Hourihane, Heaton, Engles, Hause Doubtful Hause (groin), Heaton (knee) Injured Traoré (hamstring, 21 Nov), Wesley (knee, Jan) Suspended None Discipline Y14 R0 Form WWWWLL Leading scorer Grealish, Watkins 4
